questions.question: 1. In a non-orthogonal coordinate system, how are point coordinates represented?

answers.a: As distances parallel to the axes.
answers.b: As perpendicular distances from orthogonal axes.

explanations.a: Correct! In a non-orthogonal coordinate system, point coordinates are represented as distances taken parallel to the axes.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This describes orthogonal coordinate systems.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is true for any coordinate system, not just non-orthogonal ones.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Angles are not typically used to represent point coordinates directly.

questions.question: 2. If the coordinates of a point in 3D space are (2,3,4), which plane is it 2 units away from?

explanations.a: Incorrect. (2,3,4) is not 2 units away from the XY-plane.
explanations.b: Correct! In (2,3,4), the point is 2 units away from the YZ-plane.
explanations.c: Incorrect. (2,3,4) is not 2 units away from the XZ-plane.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It is 2 units away from the YZ-plane.

questions.question: 3. How are absolute coordinates related to relative coordinates in a coordinate system?

answers.b: Absolute coordinates are independent of the coordinate system.
answers.c: Relative coordinates are derived from absolute coordinates and the coordinate system.
answers.d: Relative coordinates are always larger than absolute coordinates.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Absolute and relative coordinates differ in most cases.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Absolute coordinates are affected by the coordinate system.
explanations.c: Correct! Relative coordinates are derived from absolute coordinates and the coordinate system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Relative coordinates can be smaller or larger depending on the context.

questions.question: 4. Explain the concept of a non-orthogonal coordinate system and its implications on point representation.

answers.b: It makes points easier to render.
answers.c: It represents distances parallel to the axes.
answers.d: It allows for more flexible positioning of points.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Non-orthogonal systems can be more complex.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Rendering ease is not the primary benefit of non-orthogonal systems.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Distances parallel to the axes can be represented in both orthogonal and non-orthogonal systems.
explanations.d: Correct! A non-orthogonal coordinate system allows for more flexible positioning of points as distances are represented parallel to the axes.

questions.question: 5. How does switching from 2D to 3D view impact the representation of points in a computer graphics scene?

answers.a: It has no effect on point representation.
answers.c: Points are now represented in three-dimensional space.
answers.d: It only changes the perspective but not the coordinates.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Switching to 3D view fundamentally changes point representation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Distortion is not a typical result of switching to 3D view.
explanations.c: Correct! Switching from 2D to 3D view represents points in three-dimensional space in a computer graphics scene.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The coordinates are now represented in three dimensions.
